Package group2.monopoly.game.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
group2.monopoly.game.controller.GameController
@RestController @RequestMapping(value="/api/game", produces="application/json", consumes="application/json") public class GameController extends Object
Controller for mapping in-game requests.

    • createGame

      Creates a new game with the supplied game name.
      Parameters:
      dto - GameCreateDTO object
      authentication - Authentication object supplied by Spring Security
      Returns:
      created Game
      Throws:
      GameManagementException - if a game with such name already exists

    • deleteGame

      @ResponseStatus(NO_CONTENT) @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public void deleteGame(@PathVariable("id") Long id, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication) throws GameManagementException
      Deletes a game.
      Parameters:
      id - Id of the Game object
      authentication - Authentication object supplied by Spring Security
      Throws:
      GameManagementException - if the game is already completed or the user is not authorized to delete the game

    • interactWithGame

      @PostMapping("/{id}") public Game interactWithGame(@PathVariable("id") Long id, @RequestBody GameInteractionDTO dto, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication) throws GameManagementException, GameFaultyMoveException, GameOverException
      Simulates a whole turn in game

      The human player is in the purchase phase of their turn. Depending on the user's decision in the request, the purchase is made. Following this, AI player plays a whole turn (consisting of movement phase and purchase phase). Finally, the movement phase of the human player is simulated and the resulting game state is sent as response to the user, waiting for a new request to decide the action in the next purchase phase.
      Parameters:
      id - Id of the Game object
      dto - GameInteractionDTO object for specifying the action in purchase phase
      authentication - Authentication object supplied by Spring Security
      Returns:
      The resulting game state
      Throws:
      GameManagementException - if the user has no access to such game
      GameFaultyMoveException - if the user wants to buy a cell that can't be purchased (already purchased, not a property etc.)
      GameOverException - if a player goes bankrupt within simulated the game turn

    • nukeGame

      @PostMapping("/{id}/nuke") public Game nukeGame(@PathVariable("id") Long id, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication, @RequestBody Map<String,Integer> params) throws GameManagementException, GameOverException
      Nukes the game by afflicting the specified player with crippling debt.

      The player surely will never financially recover from this.
      Parameters:
      id - Id of the Game object
      authentication - Authentication object supplied by Spring Security
      params - A Map with key "id" and value of a player id
      Returns:
      The resulting game state if the player survives
      Throws:
      GameManagementException - if the user has no access to such game
      GameOverException - if the victim goes bankrupt
